item.title: Nvidia, AMD Sell Chips to Saudi Arabia for AI Data Centers
item.description: Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. will supply semiconductors to Saudi Arabian artificial intelligence company Humain for a massive data center project, acting under a Trump administration initiative that lifts restrictions on delivering advanced technology to the region.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri, Ian King

item.title: Milei Is Scrapping Tariffs That Put $2,000 Price Tags on iPhones
item.description: President Javier Milei cut tariffs that made Argentina one of the most expensive places in the world to buy iPhones after decades of protectionist policies, delivering on a campaign promise to open up the economy to trade.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Gillespie, Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Apple’s iPhone 16 costs more than $2,000 in Argentina.

item.title: OpenAI Weighs UAE Data Center Deal as Trump Set to Visit
item.description: OpenAI is considering building new data center capacity in the United Arab Emirates that could significantly expand its footprint in the Middle East, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Shirin Ghaffary, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman waits to meet the Saudi Crown Prince at the Royal Court in Riyadh on May 13, 2025.

item.title: Saudi Arabia, AMD Plan $10 Billion Deployment of AI Gear
item.description: Humain, Saudi Arabia’s new artificial intelligence investment company, is teaming up with chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices Inc. to spend $10 billion on AI infrastructure over the next five years.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Advanced Micro Devices headquarters in Santa Clara, California.

item.title: Indie Music Power Broker to Depart Amid Industry Tech Reckoning
item.description: Jeremy Sirota, CEO of Merlin, will exit the company at the end of 2025
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: Jeremy Sirota, CEO of Merlin, will exit the company at the end of the year.

item.title: US Weighs Letting UAE Buy Over a Million Advanced Nvidia Chips
item.description: The Trump administration is weighing a deal that would allow the United Arab Emirates to import more than a million advanced Nvidia Corp. chips, people familiar with the matter said, a quantity that far exceeds limits under Biden-era AI chip regulations — and one that’s raised concerns that American hardware risks ending up in China’s hands.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard, Ben Bartenstein

media:content.media:description: A Nvidia chip. Photographer: AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Microsoft Is Cutting Thousands of Employees Across the Company
item.description: Microsoft Corp. said it will cut 6,000 workers across the company in an effort to reduce management layers.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford, Matt Day

media:content.media:description: The Microsoft campus in Mountain View, California, US.

item.title: Intel’s New CEO to Focus on Executing Its Existing Strategy
item.description: New Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan is focused on improving the execution of the chipmaker’s existing strategy rather than making sweeping changes, according to his head of finance.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Lip-Bu Tan Photographer: Andrej Sokol/Getty Images

item.title: AI Boom Helps Score $12 Billion Deal for Little-Known LS Power
item.description: LS Power bet on buying and building natural gas power plants at a time when some analysts considered them almost relics, doomed to be sidelined by solar and wind.
item.dc:creator: Naureen S Malik

media:content.media:description: Paul Segal Photographer: LS Power

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100 Erase 2025 Drop as Trade Hope Sparks Rebound
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes turned higher for the year on Tuesday, reversing a multitrillion dollar routs, as enthusiasm for US stocks grows with global trade tensions cooling after the Trump administration and China agreed to temporarily lower tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: US to Boost Saudi AI Chip Access Even as China Issues Linger
item.description: The Trump administration is preparing to announce a deal granting Saudi Arabia more access to advanced semiconductors, paving the way for increased data center capacity in the Gulf nation despite concerns from some US officials about its ties to China, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Annmarie Hordern, Matthew Martin

media:content.media:description: An Advanced Micro Devices Inc. AI processor. Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: JD.com Grows Fastest Since 2022 Amid Contest with Meituan
item.description: JD.com Inc.’s revenue grew at its fastest pace in three years after stimulus measures from Beijing and an aggressive drive to compete with Meituan in food delivery helped revitalize consumer spending.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding, Claire Che

media:content.media:description: Signage of JD.com

item.title: Alphabet Analyst Says ‘Complete Breakup’ Needed for Stock Gains
item.description: One of the largest tech companies would be more valuable if it was smaller, according to a Wall Street analyst.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: Signage at the Google headquarters in Mountain View, California, US, on Wednesday, April 23, 2025. Alphabet Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on April 24. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Sea Profit Tops Estimates as Online Shoppers Keep Spending
item.description: Sea Ltd. reported profit that topped analysts’ estimates, a sign that the Southeast Asian e-commerce leader is holding up well against fierce rivals TikTok and Lazada.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Poh

media:content.media:description: The Shopee app.

item.title: Microsoft Among Software Stocks Offering Haven in Tariff Chaos
item.description: As the Trump administration’s trade war clouds the economic outlook, software stocks have emerged as a favorite place for investors looking for a respite.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: US Firm Global AI Secures Saudi Investment Worth Billions
item.description: Global AI, a US tech firm, plans to collaborate with a Saudi Arabian artificial intelligence venture, Humain, in an agreement expected to be worth billions of dollars, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Lucey

item.title: UBS’s Lo Says Investors Diversifying From US to Gold, China
item.description: UBS Group AG’s rich clients are increasingly shifting away from US-dollar assets, turning instead to gold, crypto and China, according to the Swiss bank’s co-head of wealth management for Asia.
item.dc:creator: Denise Wee, Cathy Chan

media:content.media:description: Amy Lo

item.title: Norway Wealth Fund to Freeze Hiring as CEO Lauds AI Benefits
item.description: Artificial intelligence will allow Norway’s sovereign wealth fund, the world’s largest, to stop hiring more humans for now in an early indication of the disruption the emerging technology may bring to the workforce.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth

media:content.media:description: Nicolai Tangen

item.title: Intel Certifies Shell Lubricant for Cooling AI Data Centers
item.description: Intel Corp. has certified Shell Plc’s lubricant-based method for cooling servers more efficiently within data centers used for artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Mitchell Ferman

item.title: MrBeast Partners With Jack Link’s for Line of Jerky, Beef Sticks
item.description: The YouTube star with more than 390 million followers adds to his growing food portfolio
item.dc:creator: Aisha Counts

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA - MARCH 04: MrBeast speaks onstage during the 2023 Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards at Microsoft Theater on March 04, 2023 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images) Photographer: Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images North America

item.title: JD Logistics Says It’s Confident It Can Deliver Double-Digit Growth for Year
item.description: JD Logistics Inc. said it’s confident of delivering double-digit growth for the year and aims to gain more market share in the premium logistics service segment.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo

media:content.media:description: Trucks at the Port of Los Angeles. Photographer: Patrick T. Fallon

item.title: Audible to Partner With Publishers to Create AI-Voiced Audiobooks
item.description: The audiobook platform wants to ‘close the gap’ between the number of print and e-books in existence and audiobooks
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: The logo for Audible is displayed on a smartphone in an arranged photograph taken in Arlington, Virginia, U.S., on Thursday, May 21, 2020. Audible's, the audiobook service owned by Amazon.com Inc., big push into the booming audio genre has confused some producers and podcast networks because it is happening at the same time that Amazon Music, a separate division of the e-commerce giant, is also ramping up its investment in podcasts.

item.title: Asia and Australia Aren’t Waiting on US to Lead on Child Safety
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Newley Purnell in Hong Kong looks at the push for child safety spanning governments across the Asia-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Newley Purnell

media:content.media:description: The X app on a smartphone arranged in Germantown, New York, US, on Thursday, April 24, 2025. Elon Musk's X Holdings Corp. is evolving from a social media platform powered by mainstream advertisers to one betting on dollars generated from artificial intelligence and subscriptions, a change that appears to have buoyed its revenue lately.

item.title: Cartoon Network’s Last Gasp
item.description: The irreverent animation factory once cranked out hits, talent and profits. But with David Zaslav’s retreat from streaming kids programming, the future of the network is in question.
item.dc:creator: Felix Gillette

item.title: Google Facing at Least €12 Billion in Civil Claims Across Europe
item.description: The tech giant was hit with a €2.4 billion fine in the EU over its shopping search service. Suits from alleged victims could add billions more.
item.dc:creator: Karin Matussek

media:content.media:description: The Google Docks building, background center, in the 'Silicon Docks' area of Dublin.

item.title: SoftBank Profit Doubles After ByteDance, Didi Values Surge
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp.’s profit soared 124% after valuations of tech startups like ByteDance Ltd. rose, in a boost for the Japanese company’s aggressive data center investment plans.
item.dc:creator: Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: A SoftBank Corp. store in Yamato, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan, on Thursday, May 1, 2025. SoftBank Group is scheduled to release earnings figures on May 13. Photographer: Akio Kon/Bloomberg

item.title: Samsung in Talks to Buy FläktGroup in $1.5 Billion-Plus Deal
item.description: Samsung Electronics Co. is closing in on an agreement to buy FläktGroup Holding GmbH, acquiring the European heating and cooling specialist in its biggest overseas takeover in eight years.
item.dc:creator: Yoolim Lee, Dinesh Nair

media:content.media:description: A Samsung Electronics Co. Store in Seoul.

item.title: Restaurant Tech Startup Owner.com Hits $1 Billion Valuation
item.description: Meritech and Headline co-led a $120 million funding around for the startup.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: The San Francisco-based startup helps restaurants improve their visibility in online search.

item.title: Tether’s $150 Billion CIO Proved Himself Getting Cantor Backing
item.description: For years, crypto’s most-influential players have tended to be idiosyncratic and outspoken founders: Changpeng Zhao, the Binance Holdings Ltd. billionaire who pleaded guilty to anti-money laundering violations. Bitcoin mega-accumulator Michael Saylor. The Winklevoss twins, the vocal Donald Trump supporters behind Gemini.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Weeks

media:content.media:description: Richard Heathcote Source: Tether Holdings SA

item.title: SoftBank Backs OpenAI Reform Plan to Keep Nonprofit in Control
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. supports OpenAI’s latest plan to turn its for-profit division into a public benefit corporation, even if the overall business remains under the control of its nonprofit.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Negishi

media:content.media:description: The OpenAI logo. Photographer: Pau Barrena/Getty Images
